items.text: length on leg stump, flicked between fine leg and deep square leg

items.preText: Deepak: "@Tashin: How can you say umpire was undecided? He looked at all the possible angles and viewa before reaching a final decision."
items.text: short of a length outside off from around the wicket. Neatly chopped to third man's left
good yorker. Follows him down leg side and pings his boot. It lobs up for Dhoni
items.shortText: Kumar to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: slower ball pushed full on middle stump. Flicked to fine leg's right and Kuldeep's fumble there allows a second
items.postText: Lokesh Bhat: "From most of the angles it looked nothing behind the line. Umpire was looking for any slight proof if the foot was behind the line. Thats what he was looking for. Thats what he was looking again and again for"

items.text: length ball just outside leg stump. Looks to tickle this fine and seems to have got something on it as it lands in front of Dhoni. Erasmus says wide
full on off stump, driven to sweeper cover
items.postText: Sameer: "Confirmation bias: Everybody believes what they want to believe."

items.text: length ball down leg side, backs away and looks to go wide of cover. But this deflects onto his front pad off the inside edge
items.shortText: Bumrah to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: slower ball at a length on leg stump. Backs away and bunts it to extra cover's right
items.postText: Mamun From Bang: "Calm down guyz. Lets move on with the game and hope for a good finish from Soumya, rather than clinging on the umpiring decision - which to me looked fair enough."

items.text: lbw turned down but he's run down the pitch and in the meantime, Manish Pandey has picked up at point and run to the stumps to dislodge the bails. It's a yorker that's probably struck him outside leg. But he's a bit frenzied by it all and does not wait to see what his partner thinks of this. Pandey leaves him no chance and there won't be zooms required for this one either

stunning work from Pandey again but he misses the stumps. Hares to his right as Mustafiz deflects one towards third man off the pad. Puts in a slide, picks up in one motion and gets up to chuck at the stumps. The batsman is unaware of anything happening behind him but he survives
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

items.text: full toss outside off, sliced straight to point
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

items.text: that's well played in the end. The Natmeg from Sarkar. Yorker outside leg stump, gets his front leg out of the way quickly and gets an inside edge to go between his legs and to fine leg's left
items.shortText: Kumar to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: yorker down leg side, jams it into the leg side
items.shortText: Kumar to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: length ball pushed very wide outside off
yorker on leg stump again, can't get a bat swing in at all. A hurried bat-pad into the off side
lbw appeal is turned down. Around the wicket, length ball in at middle and leg. He jumps off the ground to try and flick this and is struck in front. Dhoni says sliding down
items.shortText: Kumar to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

items.text: low full toss on middle stump, tapped to long-on
short of a length ball climbs over the stumps as he backs away and looks to pull this
items.postText: 221 for 8. Presumably the 49th over is what Sarkar has targeted over the last half an hour. He's got here. How much would you be comfortable with as a Bangladesh fan?
items.shortText: Kumar to Mustafizur Rahman, no run

items.text: run-out decision sent upstairs. Sarkar was curiously unenthusiastic about the second run...and he's caught short by a sensational throw from Rayudu at long-on. He'd stepped out to this short ball and chipped it towards long-on. The second run was there but he wasn't confident about it if you go by how they completed the first. Rayudu fires it flat to the striker's end and Dhoni is there to catch him about an inch short.
items.shortText: Bumrah to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, OUT

items.text: length ball slanted in at leg stump, backs away and looks to slice this, but he's copped it on the thigh guard
items.shortText: Bumrah to Rubel Hossain, no run

items.text: bowled him! Bumrah finds the crease first, the leg stump next. The No. 11 can't keep this one out
items.postText:
Maan: "Donot want to b harsh but this performance clearly reflect why bangladesh fail to cross the line when it comes to winning titles .. such a great start in the final and u just through it away by some ordinary crkt .. hope they can take 2 to 3 early wickets to keep them alive in this game .. being a crkt fan i desperately want them to win this bcs so many times they have make it to finals but failed to lift the cup .. "

Mu: "BD 120/1 in 20.5 overs and 222/10, very disappointing finish, three run outs costed a lot for BD."

rajat: "3 superb run outs from 3 guys trying to break into first 11">

Parag Kajrolkar: "Credit to Sharma's captaincy.. He is learning this art of making comeback in the middle overs when the opposition dominated most of the initial half.. Be it the captaincy of MI or Indian team he time and again proved his mettle to counter attack with his bowling changes and sharp decisions! "

Abhay S Rajput: "BD fans need not feel completely dejected as India has a habit of making every match as a thriller. BD needs to pounce on any opportunity they get so as to have any chance of winning their first multi-nation tournament."

Sandeep Koparde: "The key for Bangladesh to defend this total will be their fielding. Their bowlers will no doubt create few chances and some half chances. However, if they field like they did against Pakistan and support their bowlers, they should be able to defend this total.."

6:58pm A premature end to Bangladesh's innings. They'll be might disappointed with how it has all gone for them after being 120 for no loss at nearly six an over. They left a batsman out and seemingly wanted to fortify their middle order by sending Mehidy up to open. It resulted in their best opening stand of the tournament. That, of course, was because of a masterful innings from Liton. Barely a blemish from one of Bangladesh's most talented batsmen right now. Despite India's short-of-a-length strategy against him, Liton managed to find boundaries and struck at consistently over 120 for most his innings. But around him, it was chaotic and aimless from the other batsmen. Eight single digit scores in the end, and a 222 that they got to because of Soumya Sarkar's late resistance. For India, something to be proud of. No one seemed to be getting a grip on Bangladesh for 20 overs, but Kedar Jadhav got into it and made an opening for Rohit Sharma, who made smart bowling changes and had his fields just right most of the time. The fielding itself was top-class. They'll be very happy chasing 223 after electing to bowl. We'll bring you the chase in a bit.
